summary: President Donald Trump said he urged Apple CEO Tim Cook to halt product manufacturing in India . Apple currently assembles around 90% of its iPhones in China but plans to shift about 25% of that production to India in the coming years . Trump also stated that Apple may increase its U.S. manufacturing efforts .  Experts say bringing iPhone manufacturing to the U.S. could result in steep price increases . Estimates place the cost of a domestically built iPhone between $1,500 and $3,500 . The move highlights Apple's broader diversification strategy, which includes exploring production in Vietnam .

PresidentDonald Trumpsaid he told Apple Inc. CEO Tim Cook about the tech giant’s manufacturing expansion in India . The exchange comes as Apple accelerates its shift away from China-based manufacturing .  Trump says Indian officials have offered to drop tariffs on U.S. goods amid ongoing trade negotiations . Apple has committed $500 billion to domestic manufacturing, including AI server assembly in Houston . The Trump administration has pushed Apple to relocate iPhone production to the United States .  ‘Scrolling To UBI’ — Deloitte's #1 fastest-growing software company allows users to earn money on their phones . Nvidia's gains follow the Trump administration's reversal of the Biden-era AI diffusion rule, which would have restricted advanced chip exports . The White House also said Huawei's Ascend AI chip purchases breach existing export controls . Investor sentiment was further boosted by Nvidia's partnership with Saudi Arabia's state-backed firm Humain to develop domestic AI infrastructure .  The UAE is exploring a deal allowing the United Arab Emirates to import 500,000 high-end chips per year through 2027 . Chip sector momentum extended to peers: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD,Financials) jumped 6%, and Arm Holdings (ARM) advanced 4.2% .

Intel is using a new manufacturing process called 18A, short for 18 angstroms . The process is Intel's last hope to take back the semiconductor crown from rival TSMC . The chip giant says the process will improve its performance and efficiency .  Amazon and Microsoft have signed on to build their own chips using Intel's 18A process . CFO David Zinsner says third-party commitments are "not significant" yet . Intel lost $13.4 billion in 2024 despite revenue of $17.5 billion .  TSMC became the first semiconductor manufacturer to use advanced chipmaking technology called EUV lithography to make semiconductors in 2019 . That helped it soar past Intel and make the world's most advanced AI chips for companies including Apple and Nvidia .  Backside power and gate-all-around transistors at once introduces greater manufacturing complexity . TSMC isn't sitting idly by, though . Intel staffers are "optimistic" about the 18A process .  Intel plans to add backside power to its chips in 2026 . It's also working to release N2 technology, which it plans to release later this year . Analysts have called for Intel to ditch its third-party foundry business .  Intel has secured $7.8 billion in US CHIPS Act funding, andditching its foundry would put that funding at risk . TSMC is expanding its US footprint, investing $165 billion in new plants and research facilities in the coming year . Wedbush analysts say moving iPhone production to the U.S. is a "non-starter" due to how much it would raise costs . The firm estimates that an American-made iPhone would cost $3,500 . President Trump has pressured Apple to bring more operations stateside .  Apple CEO Tim Cook has said that a majority of iPhones sold in the U.S. this quarter will come from India, rather than China . Trump said Thursday India has offered a deal “where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariffs” Shares of Apple have climbed nearly 7% this week to about $211 .  Wedbush holds a price target of $270 for Apple stock, which is above the analyst consensus of $228 compiled by Visible Alpha . Morgan Stanley maintained its price target this week of $235, arguing the stock "will be range-bound short term"

Epic Games says its popular game will be offline on Apple devices because the iPhone maker blocked its recent app update . The dispute comes just weeks after a U.S. District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers sided with Epic Games . Apple received ascathing rebuke from the judge .  "Now, sadly, Fortnite on iOS will be offline worldwide until Apple unblocks it," the "Fortnite"X account posted . Apple said on Friday that it asked that Epic Games resubmit the app update without including the U.S. storefront of the App Store .  Epic Games wanted to let users buy items outside the Apple system to avoid the company’s commission fee . The judge ruled that Appledid not have a monopoly in the mobile gaming market . Apple wants to retain the rest of its control worldwide .  Apple limited the ways that developers could communicate with its customers about out-of-app purchases . Apple would charge a commission fee for any goods or services purchased within seven days of a link that took them out of the app . Apple is appealing the ruling and has said it strongly disagreed with the judge's decision .

The president of the United States recently revealed that he isn’t happy with the CEO of Apple . In fact, he seems offended by the tech leader’s recent actions . Trump wasted little time delivering on his campaign promise to levy tariffs against major U.S. trade partners .  Apple responded to the China tariffs by shifting some of its iPhone production to India, reportedly with the goal of having its new partner handle 25% of its global production . Trump’s response makes it clear that he doesn’t approve of the decision . In February 2025, Apple announced plans to invest $500 million in building factories on U.S. soil .  Trump said he had told Cook that he didn't want him building in India, stressing repeatedly that he had treated the CEO well . This likely refers to the tariff exceptions that Apple received earlier this year, something that Cook is reported to have helped engineer .  Trump has a history of making bold statements that either turn out to be untrue or turn out differently than he had promised . Apple hasn’t issued any statements on Trump’s comments as of now . The president did add that the company will be “upping” its U.S. production .  Even for Apple, building iPhones completely in the U.S. will be hard, even for a company with Apple’s financial resources .

"Fortnite" is unavailable on iOS devices around the globe . Epic Games said Apple blocked its submission to return to the App Store in the U.S., and Epic Games Store internationally . The sides have fought legal battles for years over Apple's policy of blocking developers from guiding users to outside payment platforms .  "Fortnite" was removed in 2020 after Epic Games made updates to avoid Apple's commissions . Apple asked Epic Games to resubmit the update without including the U.S. storefront of the App Store so as not to impact Fortnite in other geographies . The latest update is set to go live on Friday .  Epic Games first challenged Apple's policy that blocked developers from linking to outside payment systems within an app, bypassing Apple's up to 30% cut of all App Store purchases . Epic eventually won out in Europe, as the EU's Digital Markets Act that went into effect last year forced Apple to allow third-party app stores like the Epic Games Store to operate on its devices .

Apple is advancing a chip for its first smart glasses using low-energy components found in the Apple Watch . The chip will power multiple cameras and is expected to enter mass production by late 2026 or 2027 . The glasses will compete with Meta Platforms' Ray-Ban product .  Moves reflect a broader effort to reduce reliance on third parties and enhance its hardware-AI integration . Investors will be watching for updates on mass production and product launches tied to these chips .
Apple (AAPL) will likely keep iPhone production in India and China, despite pressure from President Trump . Apple will continue to manufacture iPhone phones in India, China .

Stock buybacks, also known as share repurchase programs, are commonly deployed by companies to boost shareholder value . Reducing the number of outstanding shares can boost earnings per share, also helping to put a floor under shares . Arista Networks ANET, Apple AAPL, and Applied Industrial Technologies AIT recently unveiled fresh buybacks .  Arista Networks unveiled an additional $1.5 billion repurchase program in the release . The company’s sales growth has been fueled by the AI frenzy, as the company is an industry leader in data-driven, client-to-cloud networking for large AI, data center, campus, and routing environments .  Apple unveiled a massive $100 billion additional repurchase program in its latest quarterly report, putting some of its cash to work . The earnings outlook for the tech titan remains under pressure, with analysts taking their EPS expectations lower across the board over recent months . Shares faced pressure as a result, but the recent de-escalation announcement between the US and China has brought back positivity .  AIT unveiled a new repurchase program to buy up to 1.5 million shares, replacing the prior repurchase plan . Company’s cash-generating abilities saw a notable boost throughout its latest period, with free cash flow of $115 million up 50% YoY . The company currently boasts a 5% five-year annualized dividend growth rate .  Apple Inc. criticized by some, they make great sense for mature companies with little growth left to squeeze . Mature companies such as Arista Networks, Inc. and Applied Industrial Technologies have little growth to squeeze out .
Apple (AAPL) is taking a strategic approach to iPhone 17 production by expanding in India . Apple is expanding its iPhone production in India, driven by an increase in demand for the iPhone 17 .

Apple plans to import most of the iPhones it sells in the U.S. from India by the end of next year, as Apple currently makes most of its iPhones in China . President Donald Trump is pushing for the iPhone maker to add domestic production .  Tesla plans to resume shipping components from China to the U.S. for the production of Cybercab and Semi trucks at the end of May . President Donald Trump said Apple will be “upping their production in the United States.”  George Cheeks is helping negotiate a settlement of President Trump's $20B lawsuit against Paramount’s CBS News . Shari Redstone, the company's controlling shareholder, sees a resolution as necessary for cementing its $8B merger deal with Skydance Media . Cheeks has been dealing with Redstone's complaints about CBS News’ coverage of Israel's war against Hamas .  Ford CEO Jim Farley said he has never been more optimistic about the company’s future . Roche said it is concerned about its planned $50B investment in the U.S.  Kraft Heinz plans to spend $3B to upgrade its U.S. plants . The upgrades will help cut costs by making the facilities more efficient, which could help offset Trump’s tariffs .  Gladstone Capital Management Reduces Stake in Apple Inc . Gladstone has cut its stake in the company . The company is valued at $1 billion a year .

Apple poised to keep iPhone manufacturing hubsin India and China despite pressure from former President Trump . Wedbush analysts note that after extensive supply-chain work across Asia, Cupertino's aggressive India push has proven a very smart strategic move .  Analysts advise bulls to look past the next three months and anticipate an India-focused deal from the administration this fall . Maintaining Asia-based production preserves Apple's margins and mitigates China-tariff risks as global smartphone competition heats up .

Nvidia Corp. shares have found their way again as doubts about Big Tech spending subside . The stock rallied this week and is on track for the best month in a year . Nvidia’s biggest customers remain full-steam ahead on capital spending related to artificial intelligence infrastructure .  Nvidia has blown through both its 50-day and 200-day moving averages . The rally has added about $1 trillion in market capitalization since its April low, pushing it ahead of Apple .  Nvidia’s latest rally marks a stark turnaround from the biggest drawdown in the stock since 2022 . At $3.29 trillion, Nvidia is now second only to Microsoft Corp. in market capitalization .  Bank of America raised its price target on Nvidia to $160 from $150 . Wall Street remains almost uniformly positive on the stock, as 87% of the analysts tracked by Bloomberg recommend buying . Nvidia trades about 20% below the average analyst price target .  Nvidia is expected to grow revenue 54% in its 2026 fiscal year . The company is due to report it’s next batch of earnings after the market close on May 28 . The S&P 500 Index carries a multiple of 21.6 .  China’s long-moribund tech sector started 2025 with a bang . Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. shares plunged their most in more than a month Friday . Nintendo Co. aims to transition from one Switch per family to one per person, encouraging households to have multiple Switches .  Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence chatbot Grok blamed unsanctioned changes to its system for responses this week that included controversial theories about “white genocide” in South Africa . No major earnings are expected Friday .

Epic Games claims that Apple is blocking its Fortnite app from the U.S. and EU App Stores . Epic Games attempted to submit the app to Apple's App Store on May 9, 2025 . Apple failed to accept its submission for a week, leading Epic Games to pull its request and try again .  Apple disputed Epic Games’ characterization of the issue . A spokesperson for Apple said it asked that Epic Sweden resubmit the app update without including the U.S. storefront of the App Store .

Foxconn will invest $433 million in a new semiconductor facility in India through a joint venture with HCL Group . The plant will be located in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh and is expected to begin operations by 2027 . The site will have a planned output of 20,000 wafers and 36 million chips per month .  Foxconn, the world's largest electronics contract manufacturer, first started assembling iPhones in India in 2019 . Project is backed by India's semiconductor incentive scheme, which provides up to 50% of capital support for approved ventures .

Apple(AAPL) has been one of the most searched-for stocks on Zacks.com lately . Shares of this maker of iPhones, iPads and other products have returned +7.4% over the past month . The Zacks Computer - Micro Computers industry, to which Apple belongs, has gained 5.2% over this period .  For the current quarter, Apple is expected to post earnings of $1.42 per share, indicating a change of +1.4% from the year-ago quarter . The Zacks Consensus Estimate has changed -0.6% over the last 30 days . When a stock's fair value is higher than its current market price, investors tend to buy the stock, resulting in its price moving upward .  Over the past month, the estimate has changed -1.8% from what Apple is expected to report a year ago . The Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) for Apple is a more conclusive indicator of a stock's near-term price performance . The chart below shows the evolution of the company's forward 12-month consensus EPS estimate .  Apple reported revenues of $95.36 billion in the last reported quarter, representing a year-over-year change of +5.1% . The company beat consensus EPS estimates in each of the trailing four quarters . Apple topped consensus revenue estimates each time over this period .  Zacks Value Style Score organizes stocks into five groups ranging from A to F . Apple is graded D on this front, indicating that it is trading at a premium to its peers .  Apple's Zacks Rank #3 suggests that it may perform in line with the broader market in the near term . However, its Z3 Rank does suggest that Apple may perform better than its Z4 Rank #1 in the market .

Apple is doubling down on its production strategy for the iPhone 17, with manufacturing centered in India and China . Wedbush estimates Apple could ramp iPhone assembly in India to between 60% and 65% by this fall . The recent pause in U.S.-China tariff tensions provides Apple with “a number of strategic options” for balancing production .  Wedbush reiterated its Outperform rating on Apple, with a $270 price target, citing confidence in the India-China supply chain strategy and upcoming AI developments expected at WWDC . Ives also noted that Apple could face increased pressure from the Trump administration to manufacture in the U.S., but any such move would be “a non-starter for Cupertino”

Accessibility Nutrition Labels will be added to Apple's App Store later this year . It's part of a raft of features the company announced earlier this week to mark Global Accessibility Awareness Day .  CVS Health is the world’s second-largest healthcare company by revenue and reaches more than 185 million people a year . In 2020, the company introduced a CVS Pharmacy app feature calledSpoken Rx . RFID labels on prescription containers enable it to read aloud vital information .  Accessibility Nutrition Labels are available to developers by open-sourcing iOS and Android apps . Apple has been working on accessibility for 40 years, including the iPhone, iPad and iPad .  Developers who don’t have much to brag about might finally get with the program . Joseph hopes that the labels’ associations are only positive . “It’s easy to think about this sort of thing as a badge of shame,” he told me .  CVS Health-size resources aren’t necessary to make software accessible, says Joseph . “Realistically, it’s easier for smaller developers,” he says . Joseph: “They can move more quickly, they can update their code faster .”  Donald Trump’s involvement in the crypto industry is raising red flags in Washington . Couples are tying the knot in digital worlds, saving money and celebrating love in places they met online .  Meta is building a new data center in Louisiana . The local utility says Meta’s AI data center requires three new natural gas plants . The Senate Environment and Public Works Committee wants to know why this is happening .

Block (XYZ) continues to face challenges with its Cash App segment amid intensifying competition and a soft macroeconomic environment . Despite a 3% decline in overall revenue, Block’s operating income rose an impressive 28% year-over-year .  Cash App’s growth has plateaued, with monthly active users holding steady at 57 million for the fourth consecutive quarter . The competitive landscape for Cash App is increasingly challenging . Apple and Google present unique challenges given that their payment solutions are pre-installed on their respective smartphones .  Block is pursuing initiatives aimed at reigniting growth for Cash App . The FDIC recently approved Block’s application to offer consumer loans through the platform . Venmo has gained traction through its social networking features, appealing to younger demographics .  Block’s strategic focus remains on mid-market seller segments, specifically those generating over $500,000 in annualized Gross Payment Volume . Square's international markets experienced robust growth, increasing 15% year-over-year . Block is successfully expanding cross-selling efforts, with nearly half of Square merchants now utilizing its suite of banking .  Block now projects gross profit of $9.96 billion, representing a 12% year-over-year increase . Square anticipates that growth will accelerate throughout the year, aiming for mid-teen revenue growth by the fourth quarter . XYZ has accrued a Moderate Buy rating based on 25 Buy, 10 Hold, and one Sell recommendations in the past three months .  Analyst says Block’s ability to consistently beat EBIT/EBITDA guidance suggests a strong underlying business model . Jefferies is also bullish on Block, with a Buy rating with a price target of $60 .  Cash App's valuation presents a compelling opportunity for patient investors willing to navigate the ongoing Cash App headwinds . Square’s momentum, improving profitability, and projected acceleration in growth during the second half of the year suggests brighter prospects ahead .  Block is positioning Square as a contrarian investment worth considering in the months ahead . Block, Square and Square Square are valued at $1.2 billion each . Block is the latest in a long-awaited turnaround in the U.S. market .

Epic Games' "Fortnite" video game was not available on Apple's iPhone devices in the European Union and U.S. on Friday . Epic Games did not give a reason why Fortnite was blocked, but Apple said it had asked Epic Sweden to resubmit the app update without including the US storefront so as not to impact other geographies .  Epic Games asked a U.S. judge in California to hold Apple in contempt for blocking the return of "Fortnite" to the App Store . Apple banned Fortnite from its store in 2020 but allowed the game back last year following pressure from European Union authorities for Big Tech companies to comply with the Digital Markets Act .  Apple also won a case against Apple earlier this month . Both Apple and Apple have won cases against each other in the U.S. Apple has won a similar case earlier this year .

President Trump expressed disapproval over Apple's plans to increase product manufacturing in India . Apple aims to cut down dependence on China by boosting production in India, creating a multifaceted approach to global manufacturing . Investors in Apple are drawn to the company's robust innovation pipeline and strategic expansion plans .  Potential risks like tariff increases and currency fluctuations remain more critical threats to Apple's cost structure and supply chain stability . As Apple navigates these headwinds, the expansion of its manufacturing footprint seems merely a part of its ongoing global strategy . Wall Street traders drove stocks higher as bond yields sank after the latest economic data spurred speculation the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates twice this year . The S&P 500 rose for a fourth straight day . Despite the gain, caution lurked in the background after a furious rally spurred worries about an overheated market .  The S&P 500 rose 0.4% and the Nasdaq 100 was little changed . The Dow Jones Industrial Average added 0.65% . Canada’s stock benchmark hit a record with an eight-stock milestone .  The S&P 500 is about 4% away from an all-time high . The Nasdaq 100 swung from a bear market back into a bull market . The advance is building as economic tensions between the US and China ease and the White House appears to be softening its approach to trade negotiations .  JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon says a recession remains a possibility . Wells Fargo Investment Institute sees economic growth, clarity around Trump’s tariffs driving further stock-market gains . Fed Governor Michael Barr said the economy is on solid ground, but warned tariff-related supply-chain disruptions could lead to lower growth and higher inflation .  WFII’s new 2025 year-end target is in a range of 5,900 to 6,100 . The gauge closed at 5,916.93 Thursday . The low cost of volatility hedges on offer right now hands investors an opportunity to build a defense against summer volatility .  The dollar’s descent is elevating the price of hedging currency trades around the world . The correlation between the dollar and a gauge of volatility in Group-of-10 currencies fell to the lowest level in seven years . Walmart Inc. delivered another quarter of solid sales and earnings growth .  Dick’s Sporting Goods Inc. reached a $2.4 billion deal to acquire Foot Locker . President Trump said he wants Apple to stop building plants in India to make devices for the US . CoreWeave Inc. has secured a deal worth as much as $4 billion to provide additional cloud computing capacity to artificial intelligence leader OpenAI .  The S&P 500 rose 0.4% as of 4 p.m. New York time The Nasdaq 100 was little changed The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0 .65% The MSCI World Index rose by 0.3% The Bloomberg Magnificent 7 Total Return Index fell 1.1%  Gold rose 1.7% to $3,231.82 an ounce .
